executive_summary: The Hardware Stores industry has been notably influenced by several trends over the past five years. A surge in do-it-yourself (DIY) projects has increased traffic to hardware stores as consumers seek tools and supplies for home projects. Economic growth and a robust real estate market have also given the sector a boost, fueling demand for everything from basic building supplies to high-end tools. However, increased competition from large retail chains and the rise of e-commerce have presented challenges.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: A Rise in DIY Projects Supported Revenue Growth
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: In recent years, the rise of home improvements and DIY trends has significantly benefited hardware stores. One of the main reasons for this is that these tasks require tools, materials and other supplies, which are often found in hardware stores. This increased traffic, not only in terms of frequent customers but also in expanding the customer base to include a larger DIY enthusiast population.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Positive Economic Trends Have Benefited the Industry
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Despite fluctuations, overall positive economic conditions have benefited hardware stores. Strong economic growth leads to increased disposable incomes, providing homeowners with the financial capacity to invest in home renovation and improvement projects. This correlates to heightened demand for hardware products, from basic supplies to high-end power tools.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Increased Competition Has Pressured Hardware Stores
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The past five years have seen increased competition from larger retail chains, which has been applying pressure to hardware stores. Large retailers often benefit from economies of scale, allowing them to offer a wider variety of products at lower prices compared to smaller, independent hardware stores.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The Rise of E-Commerce is a Double-Edged Sword
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The rapid expansion of e-commerce has presented both opportunities and challenges for traditional hardware stores. On one side, it poses a formidable challenge with online giants known for vast inventories, aggressive pricing and convenient home delivery. On the brighter side, e-commerce also presents opportunities for hardware stores to reach new markets and provide online convenience.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Hardware Stores Will Benefit From Steady Economic Growth
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Despite challenges related to high inflation, rising interest rates and recessionary fears, the US economy is expected to grow at a modest and steady pace during the outlook period. Steady economic growth is anticipated to increase per capita disposable income, encouraging home improvements and increasing demand for hardware stores.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: RESIDENTIAL AND COMMERCIAL SPACE WILL GROW AS THE POPULATION EXPANDS
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The US population will rise due to immigration, increasing the demand for homes and commercial construction. Greater home and commercial construction requires more spending on hardware supplies, boosting revenue for the industry.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: THE INCREASING AVAILABILITY OF SUBSTITUTES WILL THREATEN THE INDUSTRY
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Home improvement stores, big-box retailers, and online stores offer more extensive product ranges and lower prices, making them attractive substitutes that will hamper the industry's revenue growth.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: STORES WILL INCREASE OFFERINGS TO REMAIN COMPETITIVE
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Over the next five years, hardware stores will need to offer differentiated product ranges, personalized service, and foster community relationships to remain competitive against substitutes.

industry_definition: Companies in this industry primarily retail a broad range of new home renovation equipment and supplies. Hardware, plumbing, electrical and paint-related tools are the most commonly stocked goods.
key_trends: Internal competition is intense as many hardware stores exist in the United States. Stores compete on price, product variety, quality and customer service.
Hardware stores experience intense competition from a variety of substitutes. These include home improvement stores, big-box retailers and online stores.
Revenue for hardware stores has increased during the current period. Stores benefited from rising incomes and a jump in the popularity of DIY home projects.
Hardware stores will experience ups and downs during the outlook period. Strong economic growth and a higher population will help them, but threats from substitutes will increase.
Big hardware stores comprise a very small share of revenue. Regionalization and relatively low barriers to entry keep market share concentration low.

The major player, Ace Hardware Corporation, is a hardware wholesaler and hardware store, giving it influence in two major industries. This has enabled Ace Hardware to become one of the top 10 franchises in the world.
Hardware stores are subject to a wide range of regulations imposed by federal, state and local governments. These include zoning and building laws and common safety and employment regulations.

market_segmentation.segment_description: This market segment includes household consumers and individuals. Because most tools purchased in hardware stores are for home improvements, revenue from households comprises the majority of revenue. To save money, households buy tools and machinery from hardware stores to make improvements to their homes themselves. Volatile economic conditions over the past five years led to an increase in demand from consumers as they took on more do-it-yourself (DIY) projects.

Industrial companies, manufacturers, repair shops, restaurants, schools and other businesses purchase tools from hardware stores to repair their establishments. Businesses often purchase paint, repair tools and lawn and garden supplies to upkeep both the aesthetics and functionality of facilities. An increase in the number of businesses and raised demand for hardware from companies caused this segment's revenue share to creep upward during the current period.

This market segment includes building contractors, heavy construction and special trade contractors. Households or companies hire contractors to perform repairs. Because tools are often less expensive at home improvement stores compared with smaller hardware stores, contractors often prefer to shop at those stores. Contractors go to hardware stores when they're located near their work site. Because of uncertain economic conditions, demand for remodeling has declined, and contractors' revenue share has crept downward during the current period.

Government bodies, including federal, state and local departments, bureaus and institutes, comprise a small share of revenue since they sometimes buy hardware for improvements and remodeling. The involvement of public agencies in construction projects and infrastructure maintenance creates additional demand for hardware products. Government spending surged during COVID-19, so agencies had more funds to improve their structures, raising this segment's revenue share.

products_and_services.product_description: Hardware tools and machinery include saws, multimeters, tape measures and cable testers. Hardware constitutes the largest product segment for the industry because items like tools, fasteners, building materials and locks are essential for property maintenance, home improvements and construction operations. A rise in private spending on home improvements over the past five years increased the need for hardware products. Similarly, the expansion of DIY (do-it-yourself) trends has led to more people undertaking home projects, further driving demand for hardware.

Paint and sundries include interior paint, exterior paint, stains, varnishes, shellacs, painting equipment and supplies. These products are essential additions at hardware stores, as they're often used in home improvements. The DIY trend has contributed to a strong demand for paint because painting is a manageable project for most consumers to take on. Also, newer, eco-friendly paints have attracted environmentally-conscious consumers, creating another avenue of demand in the paint segment.

Plumbing fixtures and supplies include showers, sinks, bathtubs and terminal valves for dishwashers, ice makers, humidifiers and other fixtures. Households often need plumbers for these installations, so demand for plumbing fixtures largely follows demand for plumbers. Because plumbing is a fundamental aspect of any residential or commercial building, the need for related hardware supplies remains constant, contributing to the stable demand over the past five years.

Hand tools include blades, bits, screwdrivers and hammers, while power tools include drills, grinders and air compressors. Households need hand and power tools to improve their homes, so they comprise a significant share of revenue for hardware stores. The value of residential construction has declined recently, as high interest rates have discouraged consumers from buying homes. This has reduced spending on home construction and caused the revenue share of hand and power tools to fall during the current period.

Electrical supplies include outlets, wall plates, electrical fuses, AC/DC power supplies, power strips and extensions and thermostats. These supplies are typically hard to install, so households often pay electricians to set them up. Additionally, the surge in smart home trends and energy-efficient solutions has also supported demand, as homeowners upgrade their electrical systems.

This product segment includes ladders, lawn and garden equipment, welding supplies and scaffolding and other products that are used in-home improvements. Rising per capita disposable income and private spending on home improvements have contributed to this segment increasing during the current period.

demand_determinants.determinant_description: This industry is most sensitive to trends in private spending on home improvements, as households are the most significant downstream market for hardware stores. The growth in accessible do-it-yourself projects has enabled many consumers to personally complete home alterations and additions, boosting demand for hardware store's products.

This region is known for the importance of manufacturing industries, including big automakers.
The Mid-Atlantic region has a substantial number of hardware stores due to its dense population centers.

regulations_points.regulation_description: Since many state and local governments implement zoning laws to protect various businesses and households.
Hardware stores must comply with product safety rules so that customers aren't harmed.
The Fair Labor Standards Act (FLSA) significantly impacts the hardware store industry.

Established brands benefit from customer loyalty and recognition.
factors_decreased_barrier: Hardware stores require knowledgeable staff to assist customers.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: MOST OF THE INDUSTRY'S COSTS ARE PURCHASES
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Purchase costs are the largest expense for stores because inventory is the backbone of a retail business.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: NECESSARY LABOR KEEPS WAGE COSTS HIGH
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Wages are a significant expense for hardware stores because store operations heavily rely on human labor.
Hardware stores require knowledgeable staff to assist customers.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Incomes Play a Significant Role in Revenue Growth
volatility_points.volatility_description: When consumers have more income, they have the cash to spend on home improvements.
Low-interest rates make it easier for consumers to buy a new home.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: IMPROVEMENTS IN POWER TOOLS MAKE SHOPPING AT HARDWARE STORES MORE ATTRACTIVE
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Manufacturers have been making power tools that don't use cords.
Paint makers have reduced the amount of volatile organic compounds (VOCs) in their paints.
